section.p: A reaction represents an adverse event due to an administered or exposed substance. A reaction can be defined with respect to its severity, and can have been treated by one or more interventions. Significant reactions are to be listed in the Alerts section. Reactions in the Medications section can be used to track reactions associated with individual substance administrations or to track routine follow up to an administration (e.g. "no adverse reaction 30 minutes post administration").

ol.li: SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode="OBS" Observation (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.6 HL7ActClass) (CONF-283)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @moodCode="EVN" Event (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1001 HL7ActMood) (CONF-284)

MAY contain zero or one [0..1] entryRelationship (CONF-348, CONF-288), such that
Contains @typeCode="SUBJ" SUBJ (has subject)
Contains exactly one [1..1] Severity Observation (templateId: 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.55)
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] statusCode/@code="completed" (CodeSystem: 2.16.840.1.113883.5.14 HL7ActStatus) (CONF-285, CONF-286)
A reaction observation MAY contain one or more reation interventions. (CONF-280)

The value for entryRelationship / @typeCode in a relationship between a reaction observation and reaction intervention SHALL be "RSON" "Has reason" 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1002 ActRelationshipType STATIC. (CONF-296)

A reaction intervention SHALL be represented as a procedure activity (templateId 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.29), a medication activity (templateId 2.16.840.1.113883.10.20.1.24), or some other clinical statement. (CONF-297)
